lead_paragraph: The resignation of Wells Fargo’s chief executive is an all-too-rare example of corporate governance working the way it should.

headline.print_headline: Justifiably, This Buck Stopped With the Chief Executive
headline.main: For John Stumpf, the Buck Stopped Where It Should Have

snippet: The resignation of Wells Fargo’s chief executive is an all-too-rare example of corporate governance working the way it should....
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column says case of Wells Fargo chief executive John G Stumpf, who resigned after being held accountable for multiyear sham account scandal, offers all-too-rare example of corporate governance working in its intended way.
